statements.name: PROC SMPROJECT
statements.help:
PROC SMPROJECT  NAME=<libref.>data-table<options>;                 
	DATETIME variable-name;                 
	INPUT variable-list;                 
	MODEL model-spec-list</ options>;                 
	STABLE variable-name;                 
	TARGET variable-name;

arguments.name: NAME=
arguments.description: generates a SAS data set to contain the project repository

arguments.name: ALPHA=
arguments.description: specifies the significance level for computing confidence limits for historical fit and holdout forecast

arguments.name: BEST=
arguments.description: specifies how many best models from the successfully calibrated models for the project are to be selected for scoring

arguments.name: DATA=
arguments.description: specifies a name to be used for the training data table for this project

arguments.name: FORCEALPHA
arguments.description: forces the value of the ALPHA= option in this statement (this value is called the project-defined significance level) to override any model-specific values that are specified in the ALPHA= option in the REG or ARIMA statement of the SMSPEC procedure

arguments.name: FORCEHOLDOUT
arguments.description: forces the value of the HOLDOUT= option in this statement (this value is called the project-defined holdout length) to override any model-specific holdout values that are specified in the HOLDOUT= option in the REG or ARIMA statement of the SMSPEC procedure

arguments.name: HOLDOUT=
arguments.description: specifies the number of observations at the end of the training data set to be used for a holdout analysis for the project

arguments.name: SELECT=
arguments.description: specifies the model selection criterion to select the best models for scoring according to the holdout analysis of the successfully calibrated models for the project: mean absolute percentage error (MAPE) or root mean square error (RMSE)

arguments.name: SCOREDATA=
arguments.description: specifies the name of the scoring data table for this project

statements.name: INPUT
statements.description: lists all explanatory variables available in the project

statements.name: MODEL
statements.description: lists the names of model specifications that are used for the project calibration

arguments.name: FORCE
arguments.description: forces model specifications that do not exist in the project repository libref to be included in the project

arguments.name: NOWARN
arguments.description: suppresses warnings that one or more model specifications are not found

statements.name: STABLE
statements.description: defines a stable flag variable to use for the project calibration

statements.name: TARGET
statements.description: specifies the target variable---that is, the variable that is used for condition monitoring
